aiAgentConfig.description: Use an autonomous agent to perform multi-step tasks. Agents use a combination of available tools and strategies to complete goals like analyzing data, generating reports, or triggering actions.
aiAgentConfig.name: AI Agent Configuration

aiAgentGraph.description: Define a graph of interconnected agents that can collaborate to achieve complex objectives.
aiAgentGraph.name: AI Agent Graph

aiCompletionConfig.description: Send prompts to an LLM to generate a single response.
aiCompletionConfig.name: AI Completion Configuration

aiJudgeConfig.description: AI Configs automatically score responses using LLM-as-a-Judge, providing actionable data points for quality protection.
aiJudgeConfig.name: AI Judge Configuration

aiTrackMetrics.description: Collect and report metrics specific to AI/ML workloads and flag evaluations.
aiTrackMetrics.name: Tracking AI metrics

allFlags.description: Return the flag variations for all feature flags for a given context.
allFlags.name: Generate bootstrap details

appMetadata.description: Specify application and application version information.
appMetadata.name: Application metadata

autoEnvAttrs.description: Automatically include device and application data in each evaluated context.
autoEnvAttrs.name: Automatic environment attributes

bigSegments.description: Configure a persistent store to hold segments that are either synced from external tools, or that contain an arbitrarily large number of contexts of any one context kind.
bigSegments.name: Big segments

bootstrapping.description: Provide an initial set of flag values that are immediately available during client initialization.
bootstrapping.name: Bootstrapping

contexts.description: Evaluate flags based on contexts. A context is a generalized way of referring to the people, services, machines, or other resources that encounter feature flags. SDKs without this feature only support flag evaluation for users.
contexts.name: Contexts and context kinds

eventCompression.description: Optionally support compressing event payloads sent to LaunchDarkly.
eventCompression.name: Event Compression

experimentation.description: Connect a flag with one or more metrics to measure end-user behavior for different variations of a flag. Requires minimum SDK versions, but no SDK configuration.
experimentation.name: Experimentation

fdv2.description: Our second generation flag delivery protocol.
fdv2.name: Data Saving Mode

fileDataSource.description: Use flag values, specified in JSON or YAML files, for all flag evaluations. Useful for testing or prototyping; do not use in production.
fileDataSource.name: Reading flags from a file

flagChanges.description: Use a listener pattern to subscribe to flag change notifications.
flagChanges.name: Subscribing to flag changes

hooks.description: Define callbacks that are executed by the SDK at various points of interest, usually for metrics or tracing.
hooks.name: Hooks

inlineContextCustomEvents.description: The SDK will inline the context inside custom events.
inlineContextCustomEvents.name: Inline Context In Custom Events

inlineContextEvaluationEvents.description: The SDK will inline the context inside evaluation events.
inlineContextEvaluationEvents.name: Inline Context In Evaluation Events

migrations.description: Configure how to read and write data for an old and new system, determine which stage of a migration the application is in, execute the correct read and write calls for each stage.
migrations.name: Migration flags

multiEnv.description: Evaluate flags from multiple environments using a single client instance
multiEnv.name: Multiple environments

offlineMode.description: Close the SDK's connection to LaunchDarkly. Use cached or fallback values for each flag evaluation.
offlineMode.name: Offline mode

omitAnonContexts.description: Optionally omit anonymous contexts from events.
omitAnonContexts.name: Omit Anonymous Contexts from Events

otel.description: Add flag evaluation information to OpenTelemetry spans.
otel.name: OpenTelemetry

perContextSummaryEvents.description: The SDK supports emitting a summary event per-context.
perContextSummaryEvents.name: Per-Context Summary Events

pluginSupport.description: Provides SDK extensibility through the use of plugins.
pluginSupport.name: Plugin Support

privateAttrs.description: Use context attribute values for targeting, but do not send them to LaunchDarkly.
privateAttrs.name: Private attributes

relayProxyDaemon.description: Configure the SDK to connect to a persistent store, such as the Relay Proxy's data store.
relayProxyDaemon.name: Relay Proxy in daemon mode

relayProxyProxy.description: Configure the SDK to connect to alternate service endpoints, such as the Relay Proxy.
relayProxyProxy.name: Relay Proxy in proxy mode

secureMode.description: For clent-side SDKs, require a hash, signed with the SDK key for the LaunchDarkly environment, to evaluate flag variations. For server-side or edge SDKs, generate a secure mode hash.
secureMode.name: Secure mode

storingData.description: Configure an external database as a feature store. Persist flag data across application restarts.
storingData.name: Storing data

storingDataConsul.description: Configure Consul as a feature store. Persist flag data across application restarts.
storingDataConsul.name: Storing data (Consul)

storingDataDynamodb.description: Configure DynamoDB as a feature store. Persist flag data across application restarts.
storingDataDynamodb.name: Storing data (DynamoDB)

storingDataRedis.description: Configure Redis as a feature store. Persist flag data across application restarts.
storingDataRedis.name: Storing data (Redis)

testDataSource.description: Mock data of an SDK. Useful for unit tests; cannot be used in production.
testDataSource.name: Test data sources

track.description: Record actions taken in your application as events. You can connect to these events to metrics for use in experiments.
track.name: Sending custom events

variationDetail.description: Receive information about how a flag variation was calculated, for example, because it matched a specific targeting rule.
variationDetail.name: Flag evaluation reasons

webProxy.description: Configure the SDK to connect to LaunchDarkly through a web proxy.
webProxy.name: Web proxy configuration
